job_title: National B2B Marketing and Partnership Manager in Odense
pros:
I can work from anywhere
Great career opportunities
cons:
Volunteer work - unpaid
Management boards changes every year

pros:
- Sense of purpose
- Flexible working hours 
- Great team (in my case at least)
- Fun and laid back work environment in which you tackle difficulties with humor and not with frustration
- A work that gets you up in the morning
- Business development and growth
cons:
- Don't expect holidays or that many free weekends or evenings, the whole year will be a complete overload, and will make you age at least 5 years
- 0 support from international management if you are not a tier 1 entity
- The higher you go the more negative you will see - expect to see some really horrible people in positions of power if you will have to deal with ICB cases.Some people really don't understand that you are dealing with people's lives and not with merchandise in this organisation. In my case it was MC members in @ in India.
- True leadership development exist on LC level, not on MC level

pros:
- Learning opportunities
- Relevant Conferences
- Professional experience
- Personal development
- Great culture
cons:
- Time management: once in a leadership position volunteers are expected to achieve what full-time employees do even though they have other responsibilities
- Lack of information management: as the leadership is changing each consecutive year information can get lost, therefore, it can be difficult to retain information and build a legacy.

pros: You meet so many people from all around the world.  You make a difference for a lot students out there.
cons: To have time for both your studies and aiesec work. Aiesec work is so interesting that many tend to forgot to study as well.

job_title: Key Account Sales Manager in Copenhagen, Capital Region
cons: unorganized..... they make their volunteers pay for everything.... totally crap leadership...
Nothing bad to say about it
